document_data.name: Haggis
document_data.location:
[[Western Heartlands]], [[west Faerûn]]
[[Ravens Bluff]], [[the Vast]]
[[Domains of Dread]]
document_data.mainbody: '''Haggis''' was an ancient [[halfling]] dish, found in the city of [[Baldur's Gate]], the [[Western Heartlands]], and [[west Faerûn]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Description:
Haggis was a boiled [[sausage]]-like dish. The casing was a [[sheep]]'s stomach, filled with sheep's minced organ meats: liver, heart, and lungs, as well as the animal's regular meat. Additionally, the mince was stretched with [[oatmeal]] and flavored with [[onion]]s and [[spice]]s.

Haggis was believed to be as old as halflings themselves. "Neeps" and "tatties" were traditional side dishes served alongside haggis by the hin.
document_data.Availability: Apart from the Western Heartlands, haggis was served at [[The Happy Stein]] tavern in the city of [[Ravens Bluff]] in [[the Vast]].
